org.jtrim.swing.access

Interface DecoratorPanelFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    InvisiblePanelFactory
    Deprecated. 
    You should rely on AutoDisplayState instead.

    Defines an interface creating JPanel instances for the ComponentDecorator. The JPanel instances created by this DecoratorPanelFactory are to be used as a glass pane for Swing components (those that have glass pane).

    The ComponentDecorator needs to create JPanel instances when the group of rights associated with it becomes unavailable.

    Thread safety

    Implementations of this interface can only be used from the AWT event dispatch thread (unless they allow otherwise).

    Synchronization transparency

    Implementations of this interface are not required to be synchronization transparent but due to being used on the AWT event dispatch thread they must avoid expensive actions.

    @Deprecated
public interface DecoratorPanelFactory
    See Also:
    ComponentDecorator, InvisiblePanelFactory

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javax.swing.JPanel createPanel(java.awt.Component decorated)
      Deprecated. 
      Creates a new JPanel instance which is to be set as the glass pane of the specified component.

    • Method Detail

      • createPanel

        javax.swing.JPanel createPanel(java.awt.Component decorated)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a new JPanel instance which is to be set as the glass pane of the specified component.
        Parameters:
        decorated - the component whose glass pane is to be set to the returned JPanel. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the new JPanel instance which is to be set as the glass pane of the specified component. This method never returns null.
